credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Tablet and an escutcheon
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
description: Vertical rectangle. Below is a rectangularly framed tablet, rising in the center, with a mask in front. Upon it stands an escutcheon with on top a wreath with an inversed shell and a crown. Above, laterally, are the upper parts of weapons, below two putti sitting upon cornucopias, the left one with a helmet, the right one with a scale. Usual background.
name: Drawing
